it owns no good base cities or forts itself [ICON_BULLET] Attack air units will now pull out of cities/forts if the defenders leave [ICON_BULLET] Airstrikes will no longer target enemies in adjacent territory when the territory is only adjacent to owned water tiles [ICON_BULLET] Fighters now always move before bombers, they're much better at taking on enemy fighters [ICON_BULLET] New function in CvPlot to count how many air units are running intercept missions already [ICON_BULLET] Added emphasis for both offensive and defensive units on the the players primary area [ICON_BULLET] If nearby enemies have no attack aircraft, fewer units are needed for air defense (freeing up fighters to make air strikes). Only applies to players the AI is actually at war with, so their sneak attack preparations remain the same. [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Unit AI[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET] AI will skip bombarding and go straight to attacking cities when it has good initial attack odds and a big strength advantage [ICON_BULLET] Stranded units with nothing to do will wait once someone is coming to get them instead of mindlessly patrolling [ICON_BULLET] Stranded settlers will now wait if someone is coming to get them instead of just scrapping after 20 turns [ICON_BULLET] Attack unit stacks will now break up when assigned to defend workers so that some of the units can do other things (protect other workers, get in transports) [ICON_BULLET] Units set to UNITAI_ATTACK will now get in transports instead of aimlessly patrolling when player is preparing invasion force [ICON_BULLET] If attack_city units cannot reach an enemy city while in land war, they will try airlifts and then load into boats [ICON_BULLET] Tweaked circumstances where attack units load into transports to encourage filling up boats [ICON_BULLET] Fixed discrepancy where attack units could group with settlers and then get in boats but were highly unlikely to get in boats with waiting settlers [ICON_BULLET] Speed up to AI_group so it loops over selection groups instead of units [ICON_BULLET] Attack units now do a bit better of defending cities in the new world if the AI hasn't sent/built enough city defense units yet [ICON_BULLET] Removed blanket block for loading transports when in land war, now handled by specific unit ai logic [ICON_BULLET] Tweaked loading of Counter units (Axemen, etc) onto boats to integrate with other changes [ICON_BULLET] Removed redundant logic from counter ai routine [ICON_BULLET] If an attack city stack is not big enough to go out on its own, but has enough units coming to join it, it will wait instead of traveling a long way to join another forming stack [ICON_BULLET] Added new flags to AI_group to allow grouping only with transports which are full, in port [ICON_BULLET] Great people, missionaries, executives now avoid or won't move through enemy territory when running their missions [ICON_BULLET] Catch several cases where unit deaths can cause strange groupings [ICON_BULLET] Large groups no longer run choke mission, will go for attacks instead [ICON_BULLET] Attack city stacks will now wait for units just about to join them [ICON_BULLET] AI will no longer send missionaries, execs, most great people through enemy territory [ICON_BULLET] AI great generals now strongly avoid traveling in enemy territory when joining units [ICON_BULLET] Transports will now avoid grouping with those that have different impassability counts (galley vs galleon) [ICON_BULLET] Lowered AI preference for fast UNITAI_ATTACK units (knights, cavalry) when they're not the strongest attackers [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Barbarian AI[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET] Barbarian ships will now often blockade cities for a few turns before moving on if they have no nearby targets [ICON_BULLET] Barb ships trapped by ice or around 1-tile islands are now removed so more can spawn [ICON_BULLET] Barb ship spawn rate throttled so they don't swamp the seas before players build navies [ICON_BULLET] Improved barb ship blockade decisions so they stick around for a while but will then should actually move to another area [ICON_BULLET] Barb ships less suicidal, more oppurtunistic [ICON_BULLET] Reduced range in which barb ships detect unprotected resources by 25% [ICON_BULLET] Barbarians now will build defenders in captured cities first, not buildings [ICON_BULLET] Barb cities now wait to build workers until pop 2 [ICON_BULLET] Barb player no longer feels like it's in financial trouble, meaning it won't spam cottages around it cities or build banks on Terra maps [ICON_BULLET] Lowered barb players weight on science and gold commerce, so that it rarely builds these types of buildings [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Pirate AI[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET] Privateers now prefer moving outside of other teams territory and enter at the last moment for a quick strike [ICON_BULLET] Fixed issue with AI Privateers being unable to group, also won't run around the whole world just to group [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Cultural Victory AI[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET] If AI moves its capital, it will no longer always block pursuit of cultural victory [ICON_BULLET] Further boosted AI's valuation of culture yield for second, third place culture city when going for cultural victory [ICON_BULLET] The AI's final city for cultural victory will now build culture much more frequently, tightening up their vcitory [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]General AI[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET] Modified city closeness calculations to use population from both cities, not just pop of the other city [ICON_BULLET] Created functions for determining when cities share the same water area (lake, ocean) [ICON_BULLET] Removed the unused partial implementation of a new A* solver for closeness [ICON_BULLET] A bonus which enables the civ's unique unit is now valued more [ICON_BULLET] Added function to calculate plot strength of teammates and (if desired) vassals [ICON_BULLET] AI will now be more likely to sacrifice green units when assaulting a well-defended city [ICON_BULLET] AI will now be reluctant to sacrifice units with medic promotions when assaulting a well-defended city [ICON_BULLET] Created function PUF_isUnitAITypeGroupee, PUF_isAvailableUnitAITypeGroupee for counting number of unit ai's on a plot in a group of a particular AI type which might actually load onto a transport (aren't already cargo) [ICON_BULLET] Created two path finding flags to weight paths towards avoiding enemy territory, useful for minimizing exposure of attack stacks, loaded transports, or privateers to enemy attack [ICON_BULLET] Created function to approximate how long it will take for a stack to bombard city defenses to 0 [ICON_BULLET] Added new version of CvPlayerAI::AI_unitTargetMissionAIs which counts how many unit target mission AIs are within a certain range (for detecting units wanting to load on transports) [ICON_BULLET] Added function PUF_isFiniteRangeAndNotJustProduced to allow counting of units who have had at least one turn of their own to move [ICON_BULLET] Units using path flags MOVE_AVOID_ENEMY_WEIGHT_x now will also try to end each turn not in/adjacent to enemy territory when possible, used by AI transports to there's less likely to be a turn of exposure before invasion [ICON_BULLET] Added CvSelectionGroup::canMoveAllTerrain to fix issue with all terrain transports in mods [ICON_BULLET] Added CvSelectionGroupAI::AI_seperateLimitedTransports to fix issue with AI using stacks of mixed galley and galleon transports [ICON_BULLET] AI will now avoid building invisible escorts since they cannot defend [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Combat Mechanics[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET] Modification for air vs air combat to make veteran units more valuable, especially when wounded. Air v air combat is now more much more similar to land combat. This change can be disabled/enabled using BBAI_AIR_COMBAT in GlobalDefinesAlt.xml

by Almighty Theo (and heavily modified by EmperorFool)[PARAGRAPH:2]Better Espionage Screen allows for more civilizations to be shown within the Espionage Screen, as well as vital information being color coded. From within the BUG Options Screen you can turn off color coding for ratios, as well as revert back to the original version of the Espionage Screen.

TEXT.French: Ecran d'Espionnage amélioré

TEXT.English: Caveman2Cosmos introduces building upgrade lines which lets you upgrade your old buildings to newer and better once you have founded new technologies. Upgraded buildings have the effects of the previous building and some new effects. The old building is removed from the city. When city is conquered and some of its buildings are destroyed, you'll have to start the upgrade paths again from the first building. Upgrade lines are: [ICON_BULLET] Harbor upgrades to Port, then to Commecrial Port and finally to International Port [ICON_BULLET] River Port upgrades to Harbor (note that you can build River Port also in cities that are nearby rivers, but aren't coastal, but in these cities River Port can't be upgraded, because ships cannot travel rivers) [ICON_BULLET] Walls upgrade to High Walls [ICON_BULLET] Granary upgrades to Modern Granary [ICON_BULLET] Bakery upgrades to Food Processing Plant [ICON_BULLET] Forge upgrades to Steel Mill [ICON_BULLET] Airport upgrades to Commercial Airport [ICON_BULLET] Toll House upgrades to Customs House [ICON_BULLET] Shipyard upgrades to Drydock [ICON_BULLET] Arcology upgrades to Arcology Shielding and finally to Advanced Shielding. Building Arcology also obsoletes Anti-Missile Batteries which is removed from city
TEXT.French: [H1]Chaînes d'Amélioration des Bâtiments[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Caveman2Cosmos introduit des chaînes d'amélioration des bâtiments qui permet de remplacer des bâtiments obsolètes par de nouveaux à la suite de nouvelles découvertes technologiques. Les nouveaux bâtiments cumulents ainsi les effets des bâtiments précédents, qui sont alors supprimés.
Chaînes d'Amélioration des Bâtiments

TEXT.English: by Dr. Elmer Jiggles (heavily modified by EmperorFool)[PARAGRAPH:2]This mod implements on screen alerts for a variety of in-game events such as city growth and the availability of new trade opportunities. The concept is modeled after the CivAssist tool for Civilization 3, and in fact, many of the alerts are the same.[PARAGRAPH:2]The alerts will not reveal information that would otherwise be unavailable. They are simply intended to call the player's attention to situations as they arise without requiring tedious scanning of the advisor screens on each turn.[PARAGRAPH:2]The alert messages are integrated with the existing event log. Like those messages, a notification is displayed on screen for a short period of time. Messages that have been cleared from the screen can be recalled by opening the event log. When appropriate, clicking on a message brings the camera focus to the site of the event.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Alerts you can set up are: [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Cities:[\BOLD] [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pending Growth [COLOR_REVERT]- Alert displayed the turn before city growth. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Growth [COLOR_REVERT]- Alert displayed when a city grows. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pending Healthiness [COLOR_REVERT]- Alert displayed the turn before city becomes unhealthy. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT]- Alert displayed when a city grows unhealthy. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pending Happiness [COLOR_REVERT]- Alert displayed the turn before city becomes unhappy. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Happiness [COLOR_REVERT]- Alert displayed when a city grows unhappy. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pending Border Expansion [COLOR_REVERT]- Alert displayed the turn before a cities cultural borders will expand. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Can Hurry w. Population [COLOR_REVERT]- Can use population to hurry the production of a city, as well as how many population points it will take, and the amount of hammers of overflow. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Can Hurry W. Gold [COLOR_REVERT]- Can hurry the production of a city with cash, and how much it will cost. [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Diplomacy:[\BOLD] [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Border [COLOR_REVERT]- Will sign Open Borders Agreement. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Pact [COLOR_REVERT]- Will sign Defensive Pact. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Permanent Alliance [COLOR_REVERT]- Will sign Permanent Alliance.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Trading:[\BOLD] [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Technologies[COLOR_REVERT]- What technologies other civilizations will trade. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gold [COLOR_REVERT]- When other civilizations have Gold available for trade. You can set the minimum amount of gold before the alert is triggers as well. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gold Per Turn [COLOR_REVERT]- When other civilizations have Gold Per Turn available for trade. You can set the minimum amount of gold before the alert is triggers as well. [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Victory:[\BOLD] [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Domination Limit: Population [COLOR_REVERT]- When you are about to win a Domination Victory for Population. You can set the percentage away from that limit before the alert is triggered. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Domination Limit: Land [COLOR_REVERT]When you are about to win a Domination Victory for Land. You can set the percentage away from that limit before the alert is triggered. [PARAGRAPH:2]From the BUG Options Screen, in the Alerts Tab, you can check the alerts you want, or don't want, to be shown at the start of every turn.
TEXT.Russian: [H1]Civ4евещения[\H1] Автор: Dr. Elmer Jiggles (в значительной степени измененный EmperorFool) [PARAGRAPH: 2]Этот сабмод реализует на экране оповещения о различных внутриигровых событиях, таких как рост города и наличие новых торговых возможностей. Концепция смоделирована после инструмента CivAssist для Civilization 3, и на самом деле, многие предупреждения одинаковы.[PARAGRAPH:2]Предупреждения не будут раскрывать информацию, которая в противном случае будет недоступна. Они предназначены просто для привлечения внимания игрока к ситуациям, когда они возникают без необходимости утомительного сканирования экранов советника на каждом ходу.[PARAGRAPH:2]Предупреждающие сообщения интегрированы с существующим журналом событий. Как и эти сообщения, на экране отображается уведомление на короткий период времени. Сообщения, которые были удалены с экрана, можно вызвать, открыв журнал событий. Когда это уместно, нажатие на сообщение приводит к фокусировке камеры на месте события.[PARAGRAPH:2]Оповещения, которые вы можете настроить:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Города:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH: 2][ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Оповещение о росте[COLOR_REVERT] - предупреждение отображает количество оставшихся ход до роста населения города.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Рост[COLOR_REVERT] - оповещение отображается при росте города.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ожидание заболеваемости[COLOR_REVERT] - Оповещение показывало ход, после которого город становится нездоровым.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Заболеваемость[COLOR_REVERT] - Оповещение отображается, когда город становится нездоровым[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ожидание счастья [COLOR_REVERT] - Оповещение отображало ход до того, как население города станет несчастным.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Несчастье[COLOR_REVERT] - Оповещение отображается, когда город становится несчастным.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ожидание расширения границы[COLOR_REVERT] - Оповещение отображало оставшееся количество ходов до того, как расширятся культурные границы городов. [PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ускорение производства за счет населения[COLOR_REVERT] - Можно использовать население, чтобы ускорить производство в городе, а также величину убыли населения, и количество оставшихся молотков до заполнения шкалы производства.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ускорение производства за деньги[COLOR_REVERT] - Можно ускорить производство в городе за золото, с указанием конечной стоимости оплаты.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Дипломатия:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Открытые границы[COLOR_REVERT] - Будет подписано соглашение об открытых границах.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Оборонительный союз[COLOR_REVERT]- Будет заключен договор о взаимной защите.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Постоянный союз[COLOR_REVERT]- Будет заключенный постоянный военный союз.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Торговля:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Технологии[COLOR_REVERT] - Указывает на доступные для продажи и обмена технологии.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Золото[COLOR_REVERT] - Указывает на запасы золота у других цивилизаций для торговли. Вы можете установить минимальную сумму золота до того, как сработает оповещение.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Золота за ход[COLOR_REVERT] - Указывает на текущие доходы у других цивилизаций в единицах золота за ход, доступного для торговли. Вы можете установить минимальное количество золота до срабатывания оповещения.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Победа:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Предел доминирования: Население[COLOR_REVERT] - Если вы собираетесь одержать победу Доминированием по населению, вы можете установить нужный процент от этого предела до того, как сработает оповещение.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Предел доминирования: Территория[COLOR_REVERT] - Если вы собираетесь одержать победу Доминированием по величине территории, вы можете установить нужный процент от этого предела до того, как сработает оповещение.[PARAGRAPH:2]На экране BUG-опций во вкладке Alerts вы можете проверить, какие оповещения вы хотите или не желаете отображать в начале каждого хода.

TEXT.French: Civ4lertes

TEXT.English: The Caveman 2 Cosmos mod overhauls the civic system from Beyond the Sword completely. The civic system now consists of 10 categories: Government, Power, Society, Economy, Religion, Welfare, Military, Goods and Services Tax, Garbage and Immigration. The new system is based on organic ideas that can overlap and some of the new options are a bit abstract - this increases the learning curve but once you have played a few games with the new system, you will master it, after all, the mod's civics are much more influential on the gameplay than in BtS, as their effects are based on the actual civic ideology in real life. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]GOVERNMENT[COLOR_REVERT] - The ideological basis for the civilization, the executive power. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chiefdom[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by a chief or a number of chiefs. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Despotism[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by a single dictator. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Monarchy[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by a hereditary king or emperor. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Democracy[COLOR_REVERT] - Representative democracy. The people elect rulers to either defend their Constitution or to carry out the peoples' wants. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Republic[COLOR_REVERT] - Broad definition, but essentially the state is ruled by a government not ruled by a monarch but where the people themselves installed the government. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fascist[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by a totalitarian nationalist government. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Federal[COLOR_REVERT] - State(s) ruled by localized government centers which can create new laws as long as those laws follow the guidelines set by federal government (i.e. US and EU). [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]POWER[COLOR_REVERT] - The dominant sphere of power behind the 'government' choice, sometimes a class of citizenry, sometimes a political institution. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Junta[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by a dictator and his closest advisors like family members or military generals. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nobility[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by the noble class. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Patrician[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by the wealthy class. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bureaucracy[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by civil servants in specialized departments. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Senate[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by a council of the upper class. May also be part of a parliament. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Vassalage[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by the ruler and favoured nobility. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Parliament[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by a chamber of many politicians, giving greater power to the legislature. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]President[COLOR_REVERT] - State ruled by one ruler and his/her advisers that is strictly executive, with the legislative branch having lesser power. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Technocracy[COLOR_REVERT] - Scientists, engineers and other intellectuals have political power. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]SOCIETY[COLOR_REVERT] - The leading sphere of influence within society - sometimes a belief (such as caste) - sometimes a system as in Vassalage, sometimes a social class, proles/bourgeious, sometimes a political preference. They are all based on the evolution of social dynamics in our history. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tribal[COLOR_REVERT] - Society values tribal life. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caste[COLOR_REVERT] - Society values the caste system, where all people are born to their status, and stay that way for their life. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Proletariat[COLOR_REVERT] - Society values benefiting the working class. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bourgeois[COLOR_REVERT] - Society values benefiting the upper classes. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Feudal[COLOR_REVERT] - Society values a born-to-status system, but people have more freedom in their status. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Liberal[COLOR_REVERT] - Society values giving all or most of the people liberty. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nationalist[COLOR_REVERT] - Society values their country as more important than any other goal. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marxist[COLOR_REVERT] - Society tries to achieve complete equality, with no "superior" ruling class, and no inferior "working" class. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ECONOMY[COLOR_REVERT] - System of economics, how things are traded, produced and distributed. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Barter[COLOR_REVERT] - Economy without currency and runs on direct exchange of goods/services for goods/services. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slavery[COLOR_REVERT] - Economy using barter or currency that uses slavery as a base for production, resource gathering, etc. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Coinage[COLOR_REVERT] - A basic coin currency system is put in place. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guilds[COLOR_REVERT] - All commercial processes are run by guilds, similar to modern-day unions. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Free Market[COLOR_REVERT] - Economy with minimal government intervention. This is a capitalist or market-driven economy. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mercantile[COLOR_REVERT] - Economy with the intent of exporting more than importing. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Planned[COLOR_REVERT] - Economy that is planned by the government. Rules out private corporations. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Regulated[COLOR_REVERT] - Economy that uses government intervention with the free market to maximize economic growth and weaken recessions. Essentially a mixed-bag economy. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corporatist[COLOR_REVERT] - Economy that relies on many protectionist policies and government regulations put in place to benefit the corporations rather than the consumers. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Green[COLOR_REVERT] - Economy where government forces corporations to follow environmental laws. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Post-Scarcity[COLOR_REVERT] - Everything is made by machines, there is very little noticable poverty. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]MILITARY[COLOR_REVERT] - What sort of army you have, it's doctrine and how it is it managed. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Banditry[COLOR_REVERT] - No organisation in your military. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conscription[COLOR_REVERT] The majority of your military is drafted in times of need, and given little to no training. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Vassalage[COLOR_REVERT] - People are drafted into the military in times of need, based on their owing. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Standing Army[COLOR_REVERT] - Your military consists of permanently staffed and experienced soldiers. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Volunteer Army[COLOR_REVERT] - Attendance in your military is voluntary, besides the occasional officer. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pacifism[COLOR_REVERT] - Your nation believes that war isn't necessary except in extreme cases. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mutually Assured Destruction[COLOR_REVERT] - Your nation declares that any other nation in opposition will be destroyed by any means possible, even if it means destroying itself. More of a deterrence doctrine. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]RELIGION[COLOR_REVERT] - The political and social basis for your civilization's church and religous institutions. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Folklore[COLOR_REVERT] - Religion run by pagan shamans and elder storytellers. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Prophets[COLOR_REVERT] - Religion spread by non-partisan disorganized preachers. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Divine Cult[COLOR_REVERT] - Religion run by government and includes worship of the ruler as a god. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Free Church[COLOR_REVERT] - Religion run by a private-run church with immense political power. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]State Church[COLOR_REVERT] - Religion run by a government approved church. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Intolerant[COLOR_REVERT] - Religion run by a zealous church intolerant of other religions. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Secular[COLOR_REVERT] - Religion is organised by many private churches with no political power. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Atheist[COLOR_REVERT] - Government has banned religion and promotes "atheism". [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]WELFARE[COLOR_REVERT] - The system of welfare provision. May be public infrastructure, disaster relief or similar. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Survival[COLOR_REVERT] - No active welfare system. Each member of society cares only about his/her own family's survival. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Charity[COLOR_REVERT] - Unorganized private welfare. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Church[COLOR_REVERT] - Organized welfare run by the clergy. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Public Works[COLOR_REVERT] - Government invests a lot of money in public works such as public infrastructure, as a means to create work. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Private[COLOR_REVERT] - Organized welfare run by private organizations. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corporate[COLOR_REVERT] - Government gives welfare to corporation instead of the people. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Subsidized[COLOR_REVERT] - Private welfare combined with the government giving money to the poor (subsidies). [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Socialized[COLOR_REVERT] - Government supplies free welfare to all citizens. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Superhuman[COLOR_REVERT] - Most people are genetically modified, all others are lower/working class. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Paradise[COLOR_REVERT] - Everything is recycled, there is minimal pollution and no waste. A environmentally utopian type ideology. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Garbage[COLOR_REVERT] - How your garbage is disposed of. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Garbage Anywhere[COLOR_REVERT] - Your garbage is thrown anywhere. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Waste to Sea[COLOR_REVERT] - All waste is disposed of in the sea. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Landfills[COLOR_REVERT] - Garbage is dumped in landfills, a big hole in the ground. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Waste Exportation[COLOR_REVERT] - Garbage is exported to other nations. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Waste Importation[COLOR_REVERT] - Waste is imported from other nations into yours, then disposed off by other means. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Off-Planet Dumping[COLOR_REVERT] - Waste is shot into space, never to be seen again - hopefully. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Waste to Energy[COLOR_REVERT] - Waste is burnt to produce power. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Immigration[COLOR_REVERT] - How people enter and exit your country. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]No Borders[COLOR_REVERT] - There are no official borders of your country. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Open Borders[COLOR_REVERT] - There are no restrictions on who can come into the country. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Closed Borders[COLOR_REVERT] - Nobody comes in or out of your country. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Skilled Workers Only[COLOR_REVERT] - Only people with decent qualifications can enter your country. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Secure Borders[COLOR_REVERT] - All immigrants are checked for illicit/criminal backgrounds etc. before they can enter your country. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Goods and Services Tax[COLOR_REVERT] - The tax that you charge consumers for buying a product in your nation. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]No GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You do not employ a GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]5% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 5% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]10% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 10% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]20% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 20% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]30% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 30% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]40% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 40% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]50% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 50% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]60% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 60% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]70% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 70% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]80% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 80% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]90% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 90% GST. [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]100% GST[COLOR_REVERT] - You employ a 100% GST. Remember: If you're having trouble with which civic to choose, just think of history. After all, we learn from our successes and our mistakes!
TEXT.French: [H1]Doctrines[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Le mod Caveman 2 Cosmos remanie en profondeur le système de doctrines. Le système civique se compose désormais de 10 catégories: Gouvernement, Pouvoir, société, économie, religion, bien-être, militaire, biens, des services fiscaux, Ordures, Immigration. Le nouveau système est basé sur des idées organiques qui peuvent se chevaucher et certaines des nouvelles options sont un peu abstrait - ce qui augmente la courbe d'apprentissage, mais une fois que vous avez joué quelques parties avec le nouveau système, vous n'aurez pas de difficultés à le maîtriser, après tout, les doctrines du mod sont beaucoup plus influentes sur le gameplay que dans BtS, car leurs effets sont basés sur l'idéologie civique réelle dans la vie réelle. [NEWLINE]Catégories:[NEWLINE]A mettre à jour [NEWLINE]Rappelez-vous: Si vous rencontrez des difficultés avec lesquelles civique de choisir, il suffit de penser à l'Histoire. Après tout, nous apprenons de nos succès et de nos erreurs!
TEXT.German: [H1]Überarbeitete Gesellschaftsformen[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Für das Caveman-2-Cosmos-Mod wurde das System der Gesellschaftsformen, wie es aus Beyond the Sword bekannt ist, komplett überarbeitet. Es besteht nun aus insgesamt 10 Kategorien: Regierung, Macht, Gesellschaft, Wirtschaft, Religion, Wohlfahrt, Militär, Mehrwertsteuer, Müllentsorgung und Immigration. Das neue System sieht den Staat als organische Einheit aus Bestandteilen, die sich überlappen können. Einige der neuen Optionen sind dabei ein wenig abstrakt, wodurch die Lernkurve ansteigt, aber spätestens nach ein paar Spielen mit dem neuen System hat man dann den Dreh raus. Darüber hinaus beeinflussen die Gesellschaftsformen dieses Mods das Gameplay wesentlich mehr als im Original-BtS, da ihre Effekte auf aktuellen Gesellschaftsformen und Ideologien im wirklichen Leben fußen. [NEWLINE]Kategorien:[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]REGIERUNG[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Die ideologische Basis für die Zivilisation, die Exekutive.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stammesfürstentum[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von einem oder mehreren Stammesfürsten regiert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Despotismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von einem einzelnen Diktator regiert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Monarchie[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von einem Erbmonarchen (König oder Kaiser) regiert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Demokratie[COLOR_REVERT] - Repräsentative Demokratie. Das Volk wählt Machthaber, die ihre Verfassung verteidigen oder direkt die Bedürfnisse des Volkes erfüllen sollen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Republik[COLOR_REVERT] - Hierbei handelt es sich um eine weit gefasste Definition. Der Staat wird von einer Regierung und nicht von einem Monarchen geführt. Das Volk selbst hingegen setzt die Regierung ein.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Faschismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von einer totalitären nationalistischen Regierung beherrscht.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Förderalismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Die einzelnen Bundesstaaten werden von separaten Länderkammern regiert, die neue Gesetze erlassen können, so lange diese den Richtlinien der übergeordneten Bundesregierung genügen (Beispiele USA und EU).[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]MACHT[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Das dominante Machtgefüge hinter den Entscheidungen der Regierung, in manchen Fällen eine Gesellschaftsschicht, in anderen eine politische Institution.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Junta[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von einem Diktator und seinen engsten Vertrauten, z.B. Familienmitgliedern oder hohen Generälen, beherrscht.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Aristokratie[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird vom Adel regiert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Plutokratie[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von den Reichen regiert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bürokratie[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von zivilen Angestellten spezieller Behörden geleitet.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Senatsherrschaft[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von einer Ratsversammlung (Senat) der Oberschicht regiert. Der Senat kann auch Teil eines Parlaments sein.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lehnswesen[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von einem Herrscher und von dessen bevorzugten Adligen regiert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Parlamentarismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von einem Kabinett gewählter Politiker regiert. Die Legislative besitzt große Macht.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Präsidialismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat wird von einem Präsidenten und seinen Beratern regiert, die die Exekutive vertreten. Die Legislative besitzt geringere Macht.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Technokratie[COLOR_REVERT] - Wissenschaftler, Ingenieure und andere Intellektuelle haben die politische Macht.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]GESELLSCHAFT[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Die Gruppe mit dem größten Einfluss innerhalb der Gesellschaft - das kann eine soziale Schicht wie das Proletariat, ein System (wie die Kasten) oder eine politische Vorstellung sein. Alle diese Gesellschaftsformen basieren auf sozialdynamischen Entwicklungen in unserer Geschichte.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stammessystem[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Gesellschaft schätzt das Stammesleben.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kastensystem[COLOR_REVERT] - In der Gesellschaft herrscht das Kastensystem vor, in dem alle Menschen in einen sozialen Status hineingeboren werden, der sich das ganze Leben lang nicht ändert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Proletariat[COLOR_REVERT] - In der Gesellschaft wird die Arbeiterklasse bevorzugt behandelt.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bourgeoisie[COLOR_REVERT] - In der Gesellschaft wird die Oberschicht (das Großbürgertum) bevorzugt behandelt.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Feudalismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Auch in dieser Gesellschaftsform werden die Menschen in ihren sozialen Status hineingeboren, haben aber mehr Möglichkeiten, diesen im Laufe ihres Lebens zu verändern.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Liberalismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Freiheit des Individuums ist das wichtigste Gut. Alle (oder zumindest die meisten) Menschen innerhalb der Gesellschaft sind frei.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nationalismus[COLOR_REVERT] - In dieser Gesellschaftsform ist der Staat das höchste Gut. Die Bürger identifizieren und solidarisieren sich mit ihrem Staat und verzichten dafür sogar auf ihre Freiheit und Grundrechte.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marxismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Gesellschaft versucht einen Zustand völliger Gleichheit herzustellen, in dem es keine Klassenunterschiede mehr gibt.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]WIRTSCHAFT[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Das Wirtschaftssystem bestimmt, wie Güter gehandelt, produziert und verteilt werden.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tauschhandel[COLOR_REVERT] - Eine Wirtschaft ohne vorhandene Währung. Güter oder Leistungen werden direkt gegeneinander ausgetauscht.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sklaverei[COLOR_REVERT] - Ein Wirtschaftssystem, das auf Tauschhandel oder einer Währung basiert, in dem aber Sklaven für die Produktion, die Ressourcengewinnung etc. eingesetzt werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Münzwesen[COLOR_REVERT] - Es wird eine einfache Münzwährung für den Handel verwendet.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gildenwesen[COLOR_REVERT] - Alle wirtschaftlichen Abläufe werden von Gilden (ähnlich den heutigen Gewerkschaften) kontrolliert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Freie Marktwirtschaft[COLOR_REVERT] - Hierbei handelt es sich um ein Wirtschaftssystem mit nur minimalen Eingriffsmöglichkeiten durch den Staat - eine kapitalistische, marktbestimmte Wirtschaft.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Merkantilismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Eine Wirtschaftsform, bei der viele Güter exportiert, aber nur wenige importiert werden.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Planwirtschaft[COLOR_REVERT] - Eine vollständig vom Staat geregelte und bestimmte Wirtschaft, in der private Kapitalgesellschaften kaum Chancen haben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Soziale Marktwirtschaft[COLOR_REVERT] - Diese gemischte Wirtschaftsform kombiniert die Vorteile eines freien Marktes mit denen staatlicher Eingriffsmöglichkeiten, um wirtschaftliches Wachstum zu sichern und Rezessionen im Rahmen zu halten.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Korporatismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Wirtschaft beruht auf einer Vielzahl an Schutzzöllen und anderen protektionistischen Maßnahmen. Der Staat greift regulierend ein, unterstützt dabei aber eher die Unternehmen als die Verbraucher.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Umweltschutz[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Staat achtet darauf, dass die Unternehmen dem Umweltschutz Genüge tun und regelt diesen mit speziellen Gesetzen.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Überflussgesellschaft[COLOR_REVERT] - Es wird nahezu alles von Maschinen hergestellt und es mangelt eigentlich an nichts.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]MILITÄR[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Diese Einstellung legt fest, was für eine Armee unterhalten wird, wie ihre Doktrin ist und wie sie geführt wird.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Banditenwesen[COLOR_REVERT] - Es gibt keinerlei Organisation im Militär.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Wehrpflicht[COLOR_REVERT] - Der größte Teil des Militärs wird im Falle eines Falles eingezogen und ist deshalb entsprechend schlecht ausgebildet.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Vasallentum[COLOR_REVERT] - Ähnlich wie bei der Wehrpflicht werden die Vasallen von ihrem Lehnsherren in Kriegszeiten zum Militärdienst herangezogen.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stehendes Heer[COLOR_REVERT] - Das Militär besteht aus fest angestellten und erfahrenen Soldaten.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Berufsarmee[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Teilnahme am Militärdienst ist grundsätzlich freiwillig.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pazifismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Nation glaubt, dass Krieg bis auf extreme Ausnahmefälle unnötig ist.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gleichgewicht des Schreckens[COLOR_REVERT] - Jeder kriegerische Akt gegen die eigene Nation wird eine totale Zerstörung des Gegners nach sich ziehen. Dafür ist jedes Mittel recht, selbst wenn es den eigenen Untergang bedeuten würde. Diese Doktrin dient hauptsächlich der Abschreckung.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]RELIGION[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Die politische und gesellschaftliche Basis für die Staatsreligion und religiöse Institutionen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Folklore[COLOR_REVERT] - Religiöse Riten werden von heidnischen Schamanen und weisen Geschichtenerzählern durchgeführt.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Prophetentum[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Religion wird von unabhängigen und unorganisierten Wanderpredigern verbreitet.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Theokratie[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Religion liegt in der Hand der Herrscher. Normalerweise schließt dies eine Vergöttlichung und entsprechende Anbetung derselben mit ein.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Laizismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Religion und Staat sind streng getrennt. Die Religionsgemeinschaften haben eine immense politische Macht.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Staatskirchentum[COLOR_REVERT] - Im Gegensatz zum Laizismus legt im Staatskirchentum die Regierung eine Religionsgemeinschaft fest, deren Glaubensgrundsätze zur offiziellen Religion bestimmt werden.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Intoleranz[COLOR_REVERT] - Es werden keine anderen Glaubensrichtungen toleriert, stattdessen werden Ungläubige mit Feuereifer missioniert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Säkularisierung[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Religion ist in der Hand vieler freier Glaubensgemeinschaften, die über keine politische Macht verfügen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Atheismus[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Regierung hat Religion allgemein verboten und wirbt für Atheismus.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]WOHLFAHRT[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Dieses System regelt die Unterstützung des Volkes durch den Staat in Form von öffentlicher Infrastruktur, Katastrophenschutz, Sozialhilfe o.Ä.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Überlebenskampf[COLOR_REVERT] - Es ist keinerlei Wohlfahrtssystem vorhanden. Jeder Bürger muss sich um das Überleben seiner Familie selbst kümmern.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nächstenliebe[COLOR_REVERT] - Meist schlecht organisierte Wohlfahrt im Rahmen von persönlicher Nächstenliebe und Barmherzigkeit.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Klerus[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Wohlfahrt wird vom Klerus für die Gläubigen organisiert.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arbeitsbeschaffung[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Regierung investiert große Geldsummen in die Arbeitsbeschaffung. Arbeitslose werden dazu für öffentliche Bauprojekte (Infrastruktur etc.) herangezogen.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Privatorganisationen[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Wohlfahrt liegt in der Hand von privaten Organisationen wie der Caritas und der Arbeiterwohlfahrt.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Firmenwohlfahrt[COLOR_REVERT] - Anstelle der Bevölkerung unterstützt der Staat Unternehmen mit umfangreichen Hilfszahlungen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zuschusssystem[COLOR_REVERT] - Eine Wohlfahrt in Privathand kombiniert mit Zuschüssen des Staates, die an die Armen gezahlt werden.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sozialhilfe[COLOR_REVERT] - Die Regierung unterstützt alle notleidenden Bürger mit Sozialhilfezahlungen. [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Übermenschentum[COLOR_REVERT] - Die meisten Bürger sind genetisch modifiziert, alle anderen bilden die niedere Arbeiterklasse.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Paradies[COLOR_REVERT] - Es wird wirklich alles wiederverwertet. Deshalb gibt es kaum Umweltverschmutzung und keinen Müll. Eine Umweltutopie.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]MÜLL[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Hier wird festgelegt, wie die Zivilisation mit ihrem Müll umgeht.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Aus den Augen, aus dem Sinn[COLOR_REVERT] - Müll wird einfach fallen- und liegengelassen.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Verklappung[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Müll wird im Meer verklappt.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mülldeponien[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Müll wird auf großen Mülldeponien gelagert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Müllexport[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Müll wird in andere Länder exportiert.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Müllimport[COLOR_REVERT] - Es wird Müll von anderen Ländern importiert und anderweitig entsorgt.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Entsorgung im Weltraum[COLOR_REVERT] - Der Müll wird auf Nimmerwiedersehen in den Weltraum geschossen - hoffentlich.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Energiegewinnung[COLOR_REVERT] - Mittels Müllverbrennung wird Energie erzeugt.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]IMMIGRATION[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Die Ein- und Auswanderungspolitik der Zivilisation[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Keine Grenzen[COLOR_REVERT] - Das Reich hat keine offiziellen Grenzen.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Offene Grenzen[COLOR_REVERT] - Es gibt keine Beschränkungen hinsichtlich Ein- und Ausreise.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Geschlossene Grenzen[COLOR_REVERT] - Niemand betritt oder verlässt das Reich.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fachkräfteprogramm[COLOR_REVERT] - Nur Menschen mit einer angemessenen Qualifikation dürfen einwandern.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grenzkontrollen[COLOR_REVERT] - Jeder Einwanderer wird zunächst auf eine eventuelle kriminelle Vergangenheit überprüft, bevor er das Reich betreten darf.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]MEHRWERTSTEUER[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Dies ist die Steuer, die Konsumenten beim Kauf von Produkten entrichten müssen.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Keine MwSt[COLOR_REVERT] - Es wird keine Mehrwertsteuer erhoben.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]5% MwSt[COLOR_REVERT] - Es werden 5% Mehrwertsteuer erhoben.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]10% MwSt[COLOR_REVERT] - Es werden 10% Mehrwertsteuer erhoben.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]20% MwSt[COLOR_REVERT] - Es werden 20% Mehrwertsteuer erhoben.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]30% MwSt[COLOR_REVERT] - Es werden 30% Mehrwertsteuer erhoben.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]40% MwSt[COLOR_REVERT] - Es werden 40% Mehrwertsteuer erhoben.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]50% MwSt[COLOR_REVERT] - TEXT.French: Doctrines Remaniées

TEXT.English: Certain buildings in this mod require you to have specific civic option active before you can build these buildings.
TEXT.French: Certains bâtiments de ce mod requiert de choisir une Doctrine spécifique pour être construits et utilisés
Bâtiments spécifiques aux Doctrines

TEXT.English: In Caveman2Cosmos all the improvements have been gone through drastic changes. First of all there's plenty of new improvement types and secondly all the improvements gain extra bonuses from later era techs and/or civics. One other major change how improvements work is that many improvements no longer require you to clear out forests or jungle from the plot before you can build the improvement. This means that, for example, [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]Mines[\LINK] can be built on all forest plots before you research [LINK=TECH_BRONZE_WORKING]Bronze Working[\LINK] and in fact Mine does get extra hammer when the plot has forest! Improvements like [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]farms[\LINK], [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COTTAGE]cottages[\LINK] and [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PLANTATION]plantation[\LINK] still require you to cut down the forests or jungles.

Limited Religions is a game feature which allows each player to found only one religion. In Caveman2Cosmos this setting is off by default but if you want to use this feature you can enable it from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]BUG options[COLOR_REVERT] by pressing [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]CTRL-ALT-O[COLOR_REVERT] and choosing RevDCM option page.

Rise of Mankind mod adds new terrain type [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Marsh[\LINK] and new terrain feature [LINK=FEATURE_SWAMP]Peat Bog[\LINK]. Because of these terrain changes, the regular mapscripts from Civ 4, Warlords and from Beyond the Sword won't work correctly. For this reason all the default and other custom mapscripts have been disabled and all those mapscripts have been converted to work with Rise of Mankind mod. All the changed mapscripts start with the text "RoM_", if the mapscript you are trying to use does not have this prefix, you might encounter problems when game is generating the map. Some converted mapscripts are still unable to generate Marsh terrain (these require still some python "fixes" before they can place Marsh terrain) but new terrain feature Peat Bog should appear on all maps since it is set to appear also on tundra.[PARAGRAPH:2]Rise of Mankind adds 2 new map sizes: Giant and Gigantic. These maps are extra large and should be tried only on high end computers. There are still some issues with these new map sizes, meaning that some mapscripts won't work correctly for these new map sizes and the script won't place terrain correctly - more advanced mapscripts, like Smartmap, can handle these new map sizes without problems - if you encounter problems on Giant and Gigantic mapsizes on certain mapscripts, I recommend using max Huge map size.[PARAGRAPH:2]Basic mapscripts are shown in list when you click Single Player and then Play Now. Advanced mapscripts can be used in Custom Game.

Caveman2Cosmos comes with several Civ Specific Unit art styles modules. These modules are entirely optional and all of them are on by default. These modules provide alternative civilization specific unit graphics for most unit classes. So far the art styles have been made for the following civilizations: [ICON_BULLET] America [ICON_BULLET] Arabia [ICON_BULLET] Aztec [ICON_BULLET] Babylon [ICON_BULLET] Barbarian [ICON_BULLET] Byzantium [ICON_BULLET] Carthage [ICON_BULLET] China [ICON_BULLET] Dutch [ICON_BULLET] India [ICON_BULLET] Japan [ICON_BULLET] Rome [ICON_BULLET] Russia [ICON_BULLET] Viking These art styles aren't complete yet and as you can see most civs do not have yet their own unit art style, instead they'll use the default ethnic unit art style set for their civilization. Note that disabling these modules reduces the amount of unit graphics the game needs to load and use and thus this may improve game performance. [BOLD]How to disable or enable[\BOLD] The modules can be found from folder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Modules\Custom ArtStyles'[COLOR_REVERT]. To disable the module(s) just move civ specific folders with their subfolders from Custom ArtStyles -folder to folder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Unloaded Modules\Custom ArtStyles'[COLOR_REVERT]. After you have moved the folders and reloaded the mod, the game will skip loading these modules. To enable the modules again, just move them back to the original folder.

TEXT.Spanish: Módulo - Estilos artísticos de unidad específicos

TEXT.English: This module enhances Christianity religion by adding 3 knightly orders for it. The orders are Hospitaller, Templar and Teutonic Knightly orders. Each of these have building or national wonder and Great Wonder. These buildings are required for training each Order's unit types. The module is disabled by default. The module can be enabled by moving Holy Wars folder from 'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Unloaded Modules' folder to 'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Modules'

Caveman2Cosmos comes with Static Leaderheads module. This module is entirely optional and is off by default. What it does is that it changes all default Beyond the Sword leaderheads (50 of them) to static versions ie. to versions which do not have animations. If enabled this speeds up the load times of leaderheads and game should use less graphical memory so this might help to late era memory allocation faults.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]How to use[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The module can be found from folder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Unloaded Modules'[COLOR_REVERT]. To enable the module just move folder Static (with its subfolders) to folder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Modules'[COLOR_REVERT].

This module adds one new National Wonder and several new United Nations' unit classes. This module requires that Diplomatic Victory has been enabled. To build the new unit classes you will need to complete the national wonder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]UN Mission[COLOR_REVERT] first. The units enabled by this wonder are: [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]UN APC[COLOR_REVERT] [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]UN Diplomat[COLOR_REVERT] [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]UN Motorized Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]UN Fighting Vehicle[COLOR_REVERT] [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]UN Transport Airplane[COLOR_REVERT] [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]UN Transport Helicopter[COLOR_REVERT] [ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]UN Peacekeeper[COLOR_REVERT] All of these units are defensive units only and they can not capture cities. They also have hidden nationality so you can defend friendly neighbours during their wars without declaring war to anyone. The module can be disabled by moving UN Mission and all UN units from 'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Modules' folders to 'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Unloaded Modules'

TEXT.English: [H1]No Building Graphics - module[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]No Building Graphics module allows player to easily disable most regular building graphics in order to save RAM and stress less computer's graphics card. This module is off by default but you can enable it by moving NoBuildingGraphics folder (with its contents) from folder 'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Unloaded Modules\Custom Buildings' to folder 'Caveman2Cosmos\Assets\Modules\Custom Buildings'. If you using low end computer or are experiencing Memory Allocation Faults at some point of the game, you should try enabling this module as with it the game will use less memory.

Caveman2Cosmos mod adds 4 new ancient religions: Amun-Ra, Hellenism, Nagualism and Zoroastrianism. The mod also makes all the religions more unique which means that each religion's building modifiers and religion's commerce rates are different from another religion. The base for these changes has been mostly Eusebius World Religion Revival mod (made for Warlords expansion). Besides making religions more unique, there are couple other changes as well: [ICON_BULLET] New religions build Pantheon type of building instead of Cathedral and Pantheons become available earlier than Cathedrals. [ICON_BULLET] Most religions have now 2 religious Great Wonders [ICON_BULLET] Some religions can build religious National Wonders.

TEXT.English: by TheLopez, modified by Ruff_hi[PARAGRAPH:2]This mod "stacks" the specialized citizens, super specialized citizens and angry citizens instead of displaying them side-by-side. It also makes use of the space to the left of the specialized citizens by allowing them to span into two columns instead of just one. This will allow for more than the vanilla six specialized citizens to exist in the game.

TEXT.English: by Trojan Sheep[PARAGRAPH:2]Spies now have new lines of promotions to improve their abilities (Deception I-III; Security I-III; Improvise I-V; Logistics I-III; Loyalty; Instigator I-III; Alchemist I-III; Escape Artist I-II), and have access to a special assassination mission. This allows them to destroy lone units for an espionage cost, but does not send them back to the capital upon completion. Any unit can be destroyed assuming it can be caught alone. The cost is based on both the hammer cost and level of the unit. The difficulty is based solely on the level. Spies may gain XP from performing missions (scales by difficulty), catching other spies and from having an Intelligence Agency (2) or a Scotland Yard (3) in the city. A new counter-espionage timer displays next to player's names on the scoreboard. You can now sabotage buildings in a city regardless of whether or not it has a monument in it, and no no longer always receive the "recent mission" penalty.
TEXT.Russian: [H1]Супершпионы[\H1][NEWLINE]автор Trojan Sheep[PARAGRAPH:2]У шпионов теперь есть Квалификации для улучшения их способностей. Подробности смотрите ниже.[PARAGRAPH:2]У шпионов теперь есть доступ к специальной миссии убийства. Это позволяет им уничтожать одиночные отряды за очки шпионажа, но сам не возвращается обратно в столицу после завершения миссии. Любое подразделение может быть уничтожено, если угодит в ловушку в одиночку. Стоимость миссии зависит как от количества молотков, так и от уровня отряда. Сложность миссии основана исключительно на уровне жертвы.[PARAGRAPH:2]Шпионы получают очки опыта от выполнения заданий (масштабируется по сложности), поимки вражеских шпионов и наличия в городе Разведслужбы (2) или Скотланд-Ярда (3).[PARAGRAPH:2]Новый счетчик шпионажа отображается рядом с именами игроков на табло.[PARAGRAPH:2]Теперь вы можете саботировать строительства зданий в городе независимо от того, есть ли в нем памятник.[PARAGRAPH:2]Теперь вы не всегда получаете штрафы за «недавние миссии».[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Квалификации:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET]Хитрость I-III[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET]Безопасность I-III[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET]Импровизация I-V[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET]Логистика I-III[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET]Лояльность[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET]Подстрекатель I-III[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET]Алхимик I-III[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET]Мастер побега I-II

TEXT.English: by ruff_hi[PARAGRAPH:2]This document explains the unit naming convention used in the BUG Mod. It documents what is meant to happen, not necessarily what actually happens. If you find a situation where this document differs from the unit name actually generated within the game, then please report it as a bug.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pressing [BOLD]Alt+Ctrl+N[\BOLD], you'll access a test window, where you can insert a naming convention and see the result applied to the first unit type and the first city you have built (this is why if you have not yet built a unit and a city, the test windows will not work). In the test window there are two "OK" buttons: one of them uses (and increases) the counter, the other doesn't: if you use the counter, the numbers "used" in the test window will not be available anymore in the game for that unit type (unless reloading the game, of course); on the other hand, to test some complex naming conventions, it is useful to use the counter.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Instructions[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]This mod can be configured in the Unit Naming tab of the BUG Options Screen ([BOLD]Alt+Ctrl+O[\BOLD]). First of all, you have to enable it selecting the 'Enabled' checkbox. Then, you can insert your general naming convention in the 'Default' text box and specific naming conventions for each unit type in the text boxes below it; of course, these specific naming conventions will have an higher priority over the general one.[PARAGRAPH:2]You can also select the 'Use Advanced Methods' checkbox to enable the use of the advanced Era-related setting in the '[BOLD]Adv Unit Naming.ini[\BOLD]' file (to set or change these naming conventions, you have to manually edit this file); when set and enabled, these naming conventions have the highest priority over the general and the unit type ones.[PARAGRAPH:2]See '...Rise of Mankind\Docs from combined mods\BUG Mod Help-ENG.chm' for more info about Unit Naming. The help file describes in great detail what codes you can use to customize your unit names.

by asioasioasio[PARAGRAPH:2]This modification will extend the City Bar by around 25% it's normal size. This will allow for longer names many users experience when using translations of Civilization 4.

The Ruthless AI Gameoption will make the AI much more manipulative and harder to beat than normal or Aggressive AI. The AI will use techs and gold to hire war allies, often sparking small border disputes into raging world wars that ultimately will work to their advantage. Expect to be sneak attacked, or worse, blitzed, as the AI sieze poorly defended border cities, and gobbles up smaller city-states. The AI will remember your breaches of trust more keenly; it may be wiser to die an honorable death then become the next Benedict Arnold. Lastly; suspect every AI request; an ordinary map request may actually be a search for future attack sites, so be prepared for pre-emptive strikes.
TEXT.French: L'option de Jeu IA sans Merci active une I.A. plus manipulatrise et plus difficile à battre qu'avec le mode normal, ou même IA Aggresive. L'IA va utiliser ses technologies et son or pour trouver des alliées de guerre, transformant ainsi des disputes de frontières en guerre généralisée qui leur donneront l'avantage. Attendez vous à être pris par surprise, l'IA s'emparant plus facilement des cités limitrophes sans défense et gobant les petits états-cités. L'IA se souviendra également de vos actes de trahison et peinera à vous faire confiance; enfin, prenez garde à chaque demande diplomatique: une demande de cartes peut tout simplement être une recherche des points vulnérables de votre Empire.
TEXT.German: Diese Spieloption sorgt dafür, dass die KI viel manipulativer und schwerer zu schlagen ist als die normale und aggressive KI. Die KI wird Technologien und Geld einsetzen, um sich Kriegsverbündete zu kaufen. Dadurch können sich kleine Grenzdispute zu wahren Weltkriegen aufschaukeln, die sich auf alle Fälle zum Vorteil der Computergegner entwickeln werden. Bei skrupelloser KI sollte man immer damit rechnen, aus dem Hinterhalt angegriffen oder einfach überrannt zu werden, denn die KI reißt schlecht geschützte Grenzstädte an sich und verschlingt kleinere Stadtstaaten. Außerdem werden sich die Computergegner an alle Vertrauensbrüche erinnern. Es wäre besser, einen ehrenvollen Tod zu sterben, als der nächste Benedict Arnold zu werden. Noch ein letzter Hinweis: Man sollte immer das Schlimmste hinter KI-Anfragen vermuten! Die Bitte um einen einfachen Kartenaustausch könnte der Suche nach einer guten Angriffsmöglichkeit dienen und ihr könnten Präventivschläge folgen.
TEXT.Italian: L'opzione IA spietata renderà l'IA molto più manipolativa e più difficile da battere di un'IA normale o aggressiva. L'intelligenza artificiale utilizzerà tecnologie e oro per ottenere alleati di guerra, spesso trasformando le piccole dispute di confine in furiose guerre mondiali che alla fine funzionano a loro vantaggio. Aspettatevi di essere attaccati di nascosto, o peggio, mentre l'IA assedia città di confine scarsamente difese, e divora più piccole città-stato. L'IA terrà in memoria le violazioni di fiducia in maniera più intensa, può essere più saggio morire una morte onorevole che diventare il prossimo Benedict Arnold. Infine, sospetta ogni richiesta dell'IA; una richiesta sulla carta normale può effettivamente essere una ricerca di siti di attacco in futuro, in modo da essere preparati per attacchi preventivi.

TEXT.Italian: IA spietata

TEXT.English: Surround and Destroy adds a new combat attribute, favoring players whose units surround enemy units in battle. When more than one of your units are surrounding an enemy unit, they receive a combat bonus against the enemy. The more units surrounding it, the greater the bonus. This makes sieges of cities more realistic, and easier for enemies who can completely cut off the city to conquer them, in a realistic fashion.
TEXT.French: Encercler et Détruire ajoute un paramètre supplémentaire au système de combat, en favorisant les joueurs dont les unités entourent leurs ennemis dans les batailles. Lorsqu'il y a plus d'une de vos unités qui encerclent un ennemi, elle vont recevoir un bonus, qui dépendra du nombre d'unités. Cela rend les sièges des Villes plus réalistes.
TEXT.German: Mit der Einkesselung werden Spielern neue militärische Möglichkeiten eröffnet. Wenn eine Armee eine gegnerische Einheit umstellt hat (d.h. ihre Einheiten stehen auf mindestens zwei direkt angrenzenden Feldern), erhält sie einen Vorteil im Kampf. Je mehr Einheiten an der Einkesselung beteiligt sind, umso größer ist dieser Vorteil. Dadurch werden Belagerungen von Städten wesentlich realistischer. Das Militär ist nun in der Lage, eine gegnerische Stadt komplett von der Außenwelt abzuschneiden, um sie leichter zu überrumpeln.
TEXT.Italian: Circonda e distruggi aggiunge una nuova caratteristica a l combattimento, favorendo i giocatori le cui unità circondano quelle nemiche durante la battaglia. Quando più di una tua unità circonda un'unità nemica, ricevono un bonus contro il nemico. Più unità circondano il nemico, maggiore è il bonus. Questo rende l'assedio delle città più realistico, e più facile per i nemici che possono completamente isolare la città per conquistarla.

TEXT.English: After researching [LINK=TECH_CIVIL_ENGINEERING]Civil Engineering[\LINK], players may build underwater tunnels to join continents together. These tunnels allow units to move under the water, and reach areas previously only accessible by ship. Be wary though, a sea tunnel can just as easily be used to allow enemy troops easy access to your mainland cities, bypassing your naval defenses.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Construction of Sea Tunnels[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Sea Tunnels Require Access to [LINK=BONUS_STEEL_WARES]Steel Wares[\LINK][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Sea Tunnels can only be constructed by [LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT]Workboats[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT_MODERN]Modern Workboats[\LINK], and [LINK=UNIT_CONSTRUCT_SHIP]Constructor Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Après la recherche de l'[LINK=TECH_CIVIL_ENGINEERING]Ingénierie Civile[\LINK], les joueurs peuvent construire des tunnels aquatiques pour relier les continents entre eux. Ces tunnels permettent aux unités terrestres de se déplacer sous l'eau, et atteindre des zones nécessitant jusqu'à présent un transport maritime. Attention, un tunnel aquatique peut du coup constituer un passage pour les troupes ennemies, en vitant vos défenses navales.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Construction des Tunnels aquatiques[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]LesTunnels aquatiques requièrent de l'[LINK=BONUS_STEEL_INGOTS]Acier[\LINK][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Les Tunnels aquatiques peuvent être construits par les [LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT]Bâteau-ateliers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT_MODERN]Bâteau-ateliers Modernes [\LINK], et [LINK=UNIT_CONSTRUCT_SHIP]les Navires constructeurs[\LINK].
TEXT.German: Nach der Erforschung des [LINK=TECH_CIVIL_ENGINEERING]Bauingenieurwesens[\LINK] ist es dem Spieler möglich, Unterwassertunnel zu bauen und damit Kontinente zu verbinden. Diese Tunnel erlauben es Landeinheiten in Bereiche vorzudringen, die vorher nur per Schiff erreichbar waren. Dabei sollte aber stets beachtet werden, dass Meerestunnel genauso leicht von feindlichen Einheiten verwendet werden können, die damit die Schiffe umgehen und die eigenen Städte bedrohen können.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Konstruktion eines Meerestunnels[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Für Meerestunnel ist ein Zugang zur Ressource [LINK=BONUS_STEEL_INGOTS]Stahl[\LINK] vonnöten.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Meerestunnel können nur von [LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT]Arbeitsbooten[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT_MODERN]modernen Arbeitsbooten[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_CONSTRUCT_SHIP]Bauschiffen[\LINK] gebaut werden.
TEXT.Italian: Dopo la ricerca di [LINK=TECH_CIVIL_ENGINEERING]Ingegneria civile[\LINK], i giocatori possono costruire tunnel sottomarini per collegare diversi continenti. Questi tunnel permettono alle unità di muoversi sott'acqua e raggiungere aree accessibili solo da navi. Fai attenzione, un tunnel sottomarino può essere usato da truppe nemiche per accedere facilmente alle tue città, aggirando le tue difese navali.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Construction of Sea Tunnels[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Sea Tunnels Require Access to [LINK=BONUS_STEEL_INGOTS]Steel[\LINK][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Sea Tunnels can only be constructed by [LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT]Workboats[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT_MODERN]Modern Workboats[\LINK], and [LINK=UNIT_CONSTRUCT_SHIP]Constructor Ships[\LINK].

TEXT.French: Vaisseau spatial
TEXT.Italian: Astronave

TEXT.English: Constructing a spaceship and sending it on a successful journey to Alpha Centauri is one of the paths to victory. Alpha Centauri is the closest location of a potentially habitable world, so it has long been fantasized as the place most likely to contain other forms of intelligent life. Blasting into space with a ship capable of traveling to Alpha Centauri is a clear demonstration of the greatness of your civilization. Only an economical and scientific powerhouse could pull off such a feat.[PARAGRAPH:2]The spaceship components can only be built after discovering most of the modern era technologies. In order to construct any of the spaceship components, you [BOLD]must[\BOLD] have first built the [LINK=PROJECT_APOLLO_PROGRAM]Apollo Program[\LINK]. Each component's production speed can be affected by several factors. Access to certain [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]Resources[\LINK] (most notably Aluminum) can provide production increases for certain components. A [LINK=BUILDING_LABORATORY]Laboratory[\LINK] in the city that is building the component always grants a 50% increase in production speed. Finally, the [LINK=BUILDING_SPACE_ELEVATOR]Space Elevator[\LINK] wonder grants a 50% increase in production on spaceship components [BOLD]for all cities[\BOLD].[PARAGRAPH:2]For more information about winning the game via the Spaceship, see the [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK] Civilopedia entry.
TEXT.French: Construire un vaisseau spatial et l'envoyer avec succès sur Alpha du Centaure est une des manières de gagner la partie. Alpha du Centaure est le monde potentiellement habitable le plus proche, et fait l'objet de nombreux fantasmes concernant la présence éventuelle de formes de vie intelligentes. Traverser l'espace avec un vaisseau capable de rejoindre Alpha du Centaure est une démonstration évidente de la puissance de votre civilisation. Seule une nation économiquement et scientifiquement puissante peut réaliser cet exploit.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les composants du vaisseau spatial ne peuvent être construits qu'après la découverte de la plupart des technologies les plus avancées. Avant de commencer à construire ces composants, vous [BOLD]devez[\BOLD] d'abord avoir achevé le [LINK=PROJECT_APOLLO_PROGRAM]Programme Apollo[\LINK]. La vitesse de construction des composants dépend de plusieurs facteurs: l'accès à certaines [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]ressources[\LINK] (notamment l'aluminium) peut accélérer la production de certains composants. La présence d'un [LINK=BUILDING_LABORATORY]laboratoire[\LINK] dans la ville augmente de 50 % la vitesse de production. Enfin, la merveille [LINK=BUILDING_SPACE_ELEVATOR]Ascenseur de l'espace[\LINK] augmente de 50 % la production des composants du vaisseau spatial [BOLD]dans toutes les villes[\BOLD].[PARAGRAPH:2]Pour plus d'informations sur la victoire via le vaisseau spatial, consultez l'article de Civilopédia concernant la [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]victoire[\LINK].
TEXT.German: Eine Möglichkeit, das Spiel zu gewinnen, ist der Bau eines interstellaren Raumschiffes zur Besiedlung unseres Nachbarplanetensystems Alpha Centauri. Mit einem Schiff nach Alpha Centauri aufzubrechen, ist wohl die spektakulärste Machtdemonstration einer Zivilisation. Dieses Wunder ist ausschließlich wirtschaftlich und technologisch fortschrittlichen Zivilisationen vorbehalten.[PARAGRAPH:2]Einige Raumschiffkomponenten können erst nach der Erforschung modernster Technologien gebaut werden. Eine weitere Voraussetzung ist das [LINK=PROJECT_APOLLO_PROGRAM]Apollo-Programm[\LINK]. Die Bauzeit der einzelnen Komponenten wird von mehreren Faktoren beeinflusst und durch bestimmte [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]Ressourcen[\LINK] (vor allem Aluminium) deutlich beschleunigt. Haben Sie in der Stadt, in der eine Raumschiffkomponente gebaut wird, ein [LINK=BUILDING_LABORATORY]Laboratorium[\LINK], verkürzt sich die Bauzeit um 50%. Darüber hinaus beschleunigt das Wunder [LINK=BUILDING_SPACE_ELEVATOR]Weltraumlift[\LINK] den Bau von Raumschiffkomponenten [BOLD]in allen Städten[\BOLD] um weitere 50%.[PARAGRAPH:2]Weitere Informationen dazu finden Sie im Abschnitt [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Sieg[\LINK].
TEXT.Italian: Costruire un'astronave e mandarla con successo su Alfa Centauri è uno dei possibili modi per vincere il gioco. Alfa Centauri è il più vicino luogo potenzialmente abitabile, e a lungo si è fantasticato sul fatto che possa trovarsi vita intelligente da quelle parti. Spedire nello spazio un'astronave capace di volare fino ad Alfa Centauri è una chiara dimostrazione della grandezza di una civiltà. Solo una superpotenza economica e scientifica può raggiungere un simile risultato.[PARAGRAPH:2]I componenti dell'astronave possono essere costruiti solo dopo aver scoperto le più avanzate tecnologie dell'era moderna. Per poter costruire uno qualsiasi dei componenti dell'astronave, [BOLD]devi[\BOLD] aver prima costruito il [LINK=PROJECT_APOLLO_PROGRAM]Programma Apollo[\LINK]. La velocità di produzione di ogni componente può essere influenzata da diversi fattori. L'accesso ad alcune [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]risorse[\LINK] (principalmente l'alluminio) possono incrementare la produzione di certi componenti. Un [LINK=BUILDING_LABORATORY]laboratorio[\LINK] all'interno della città permette di ottenere il 50% di incremento nella velocità di produzione. Infine, la Meraviglia [LINK=BUILDING_SPACE_ELEVATOR]Ascensore Spaziale[\LINK] permette di aumentare del 50% la produzione dei componenti dell'astronave in [BOLD]tutte le città[\BOLD].[PARAGRAPH:2]Per ulteriori informazioni su come vincere una partita con l'astronave, consulta la voce [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]vittoria[\LINK] della Civilopedia.
TEXT.Spanish: Construir una nave espacial y conseguir enviarla a Alpha Centauri es una de las maneras de lograr la victoria. Alpha Centauri es la ubicación más cercana de un mundo potencialmente habitable, y durante mucho tiempo se ha fantaseado con él por ser el lugar con mayores posibilidades de contener otras formas de vida inteligente. Lanzarse al espacio con una nave capaz de llegar a Alpha Centauri es una clara demostración de la grandeza de tu civilización. Solo una civilización económica y científicamente puntera puede lograr tal hazaña.[PARAGRAPH:2]Los componentes para naves espaciales solo pueden construirse tras haber descubierto la mayoría de las tecnologías de la época moderna. Para poder construir cualquiera de ellos [BOLD]debes[\BOLD] haber desarrollado primero el [LINK=PROJECT_APOLLO_PROGRAM]programa Apollo[\LINK]. La velocidad de producción de cada componente puede verse modificada por varios factores. Acceder a ciertos [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]recursos[\LINK] (principalmente el aluminio) puede proporcionar aumentos de producción para ciertos componentes. Un [LINK=BUILDING_LABORATORY]laboratorio[\LINK] en la ciudad que esté construyendo el componente siempre da un incremento del 50% a la velocidad de producción. Por último, la maravilla del [LINK=BUILDING_SPACE_ELEVATOR]ascensor espacial[\LINK] aumenta en un 50% la producción de los componentes para naves espaciales [BOLD]en todas las ciudades[\BOLD].[PARAGRAPH:2]Para obtener más información sobre cómo ganar la partida mediante la nave espacial, consulta el artículo de la Civilopedia sobre la [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]victoria[\LINK].
